moves.1. d4: My first annotation...I thought that this was an interesting game in that I salvaged a draw from a game that I deserved to lose. d4 start which I enjoy...
moves.3. e4: I always debate between e4 and e3.  I like both but chose e4 here
moves.3... b5: We know where this is going once b5 happens.  The queen side is ready to be destroyed and lead to a wide open board with congestion on the King side.  Here we go...
moves.7... Bd7 8. Qxb3: I control the centre and have more pressure on black
moves.9. Nf3 a6 10. Bxd7+: I could have went Bd4 maybe better than this exchange...
moves.13. Bh4: hoping that he will open up the kingside as well
moves.13... Be7 14. Bxf6 Bxf6: exchange improves blacks position but I did not have many better options
moves.15. e5 Be7 16. Nbd2: time to clear the back line
moves.18. g3: Here was a stupid move on my part.  But wait more stupidity to follow...this move accomplished nothing
moves.18... Bb4 19. Nc4 Nb8 20. Qe3: I was looking for more options with the Q in the centre of the board
moves.22... Bb4 23. Rcc1: Double up the rooks again was my thoughts here.  I was worried about hanging the rook in the centre.  Probably would have been better to move the other rook to C1 and strenghten contol on the file.
moves.25. Nd2: Here is the big misake that put me down a player for the rest of the game.
moves.26. Qa3 Qb5: Good moves here to get back a pawn
moves.27. Rxa4 Rxa4 28. Qxa4: Being down a player I am trying to eliminate the threats and push for the end game.  I know that the bishop is not as tough to deal with in a pawn battle as a knight...
moves.28... Qxa4 29. Rxa4: Here we go into the end game
moves.29... Rd8: black attacks the weakest pawn as expected.  I need to create some congestion...
moves.30. f4: I know that I need to get my pawns off the black squares
moves.31. Kg2 Bxd4 32. h4 Kh7: I questioned this move by black at the time.  I was considering Ra7 here for pressure on f7 but decided against it and decided Kf3 was better
moves.33. Kf3 Kg6: Just what I was hoping for
moves.34. g4: I like my wall of pawns here
moves.34... Bc3: Looking to check me with Rd3
moves.35... Kh7 36. Ke4: prevent the check and get into stronger position.  At this point white isstill way behind but I see some hope
moves.36... g6 37. hxg6+ Kxg6: Black has isolated his pawn on h6 in lieu of leaving e6 alone.  Good news for white.  Perhaps fXe6 would have been stronger in the end.
moves.38. f5+: exchanges to keep his pawn on h6 isolated
moves.38... exf5+ 39. gxf5+ Kg5 40. e6: White is looking better but still behind.  Position has improved.
moves.40... Re8: I think h5 march would be better in hindsight
moves.41... fxe6+ 42. fxe6: I am surviving ok at this point
moves.44... h5 45. e7: logical last ditch chance for a winning position
moves.45... Bb4: ah the bishop!  Thwarted...but the draw is still alive
moves.48... Kg8: here is where the draw is sealed
moves.49... Rxf8 50. exf8=Q+ Bxf8 51. Kf5 h4: Would Be7 have won this for black?  protect the pawn til the black king was in place to support the march from the front?  I knew that with h4 that this was a drawn position.
moves.52. Kg4: click ahead for the eventual draw.  Thanks for the game and thanks for checking out my attempt at annotation.  Cheers  Superglue

gameName: Salvage a Draw from A Lost Cause
